wesm commented on pull request #4880: ARROW-5934: [Python] Bundle arrow's LICENSE with the wheels
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4880#discussion_r303517542
 
 

 ##########
 File path: LICENSE.txt
 ##########
 @@ -936,6 +937,732 @@ support library is itself covered by the above license.
 
 --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 
+3rdparty dependency gRPC is statically linked in certain binary
 
 Review comment:
   What do you think about putting each license in its own file in a licenses directory like Apache Spark? This is easier to manage and also makes the binary licenses more visible
   
   https://github.com/apache/spark/tree/master/licenses-binary
   
   I think we should probably also start managing the licenses for thirdparty source inclusions in their own directory like Apache Spark.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.

users@infra.apache.org

issuetype.description: A task that needs to be done.
issuetype.name: Task

fields.description:
Guide to bundle LICENSE files with the wheels: https://wheel.readthedocs.io/en/stable/user_guide.html#including-license-files-in-the-generated-wheel-file

We also need to ensure, that all thirdparty dependencies' license are attached to it, especially because we're statically linking multiple 3rdparty dependencies, and for example uriparser is missing from the LICENSE file.

cc [~wesmckinn]
fields.summary: [Python] Bundle arrow's LICENSE with the wheels

comments.body:
We should bundle both the top level LICENSE.txt and the one under pyarrow:
- https://github.com/apache/arrow/blob/master/LICENSE.txt
- https://github.com/apache/arrow/blob/master/python/LICENSE.txt

Although wheel supports adding multiple license files, they have the same name so in order to properly bundle both we either need to rename those or concatenate into a single file.
